text: My name is Albino Tonnina
I'm a self-taught web engineer
I've been a freelancer,
an employee,
and an entrepreneur.
In 2014 I left Rome and moved to London
(with a plane actually)
best adventure of my life 🤗
I've met amazing engineers that made me a much better developer
In 2018 I joined ASOS as a senior software engineer. I'm now a Staff Engineering Lead.
And not just work, a few things happened in my personal life as well 👨‍👩‍👧😊
When I can I like to contribute to the community
publishing code on my github profile
writing about software engineering
or contributing to other open source projects
What really blows my mind is hearing from people who say this website inspired them.
That’s just... wow. I never expected that.
It is just a personal project, a way to share what I love.
Knowing it helped someone else take a step forward? That’s everything. 💛
So, if you’re watching this, thank you for being part of this journey.
I hope you find something here that inspires you too.
The path isn’t always clear. Sometimes, it feels like climbing in the dark, guided only by the faint glow of what you hope to become.
But every step teaches you something. Every stumble shapes your stride. And one day, you look back and realize—you’ve built your own mountain.
Keep climbing. The view is worth it.
I used to think the best developers were the ones who knew the most.
Now I know they’re the ones who help the most.
